channel.title: All 317 Servers Crash... HELP
channel.description:
When ever I use A 317 server it crashes on the second click, like for example: i click where i want to go, and i click again and *poof* its gone...? it come up with:
# # A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment: # # EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION (0xc0000005) at pc=0x000000006d84a486, pid=308, tid=432 # # JRE version: 6.0_19-b04 # Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (16.2-b04 mixed mode windows-amd64 ) # Problematic frame: # V [jvm.dll+0x5a486] # # If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit: # http://java.sun.com/webapps/bugreport/crash.jsp #

item.title: All 317 Servers Crash... HELP
item.dc:creator: @killercam killercam
item.description:
@killercam wrote:

Ok, go to your control panel and uninstall all java’s that are 64 bit. Go and re-install them as if you were on 32bit. AKA: DON’T DOWNLOAD THE 64 BIT JDK.

Read full topic

item.title: All 317 Servers Crash... HELP
item.dc:creator: @HitThisCity HitThisCity
item.description:
@HitThisCity wrote:

Environment Variables

[b]That is all.[b]

Read full topic

item.title: All 317 Servers Crash... HELP
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Actually, it’s not really the 64-bit problem alone. It’s the 317 client aswell.

Read full topic

item.title: All 317 Servers Crash... HELP
item.dc:creator: @jamessemple jamessemple
item.description:
@jamessemple wrote:

your using 64 bit windows… re-download jre except select the download for 64 bit operating systems

Read full topic
